input: How can I view rubric results and rubric comments for a Canvas assignment?
expected_output:
1) Open Grades: In Course Navigation, click Grades.

2) Open the rubric: If the assignment has a rubric, click the Rubric icon to open it.

3) View rubric results: Review the rubric results displayed for your assignment.

4) View rubric comments: If your instructor left comments in the rubric, view them under the rubric criteria.

5) View non-scoring results: If points were removed from the rubric, you can still view the rubric results.

6) View additional feedback: You can view instructor comments or annotation feedback directly in the submission.

7) Troubleshooting: If these steps don’t match what you see, Assignment Enhancements may be enabled—learn how to view assignment feedback using Assignment Enhancements.
context:
Document Title: How do I view rubric results for my assignment

How do I view rubric results for my assignment? You can view your rubric results for your assignment in the Grades page. You can also view comments left by your instructor on the rubric. You can also view comments from your instructor or view annotation feedback comments directly in a submission . Note: If the steps in this lesson are different from what you see in your course, Assignment Enhancements may be enabled. Learn how to view assignment feedback using Assignment Enhancements .  Open Grades In Course Navigation, click the Grades link. Open Rubric If an assignment has a rubric, the assignment will display the rubric icon. To open the rubric, click the Rubric icon. View Rubric Results View the rubric results for your assignment. View Non-Scoring Rubric Results If your instructor has removed points from the rubric, you can still view the rubric results for your assignment. View Rubric Comments If your instructor has left comments in your rubric, you can view them under the rubric criteria. Note: This text will only appear if your instructor has left comments in the rubric.

input: How do students view Roll Call Attendance in Canvas Grades?
expected_output:
1) In Course Navigation, click Grades.
2) Click the Roll Call Attendance assignment name.
3) If prompted the first time, click Authorize to authorize your account.
4) View submission details:
   - See the attendance overview graph and legend (green = on time/present, yellow = late, red = absent).
   - Note the total percentage of days marked as on time.
5) Scroll to View Late and Absent Dates to see specific days with date, day of week, status, and percentage points earned.
6) If the Roll Call Attendance assignment isn’t visible in Grades, you can access it via the Assignments page (if your instructor allowed this). Open the Attendance assignment there.
7) If the attendance assignment does not appear at all, your instructor may have chosen not to use Attendance for grading.
context:
Document Title: How do I view my Roll Call Attendance report as a student

How do I view my Roll Call Attendance report as a student?
If your Assignments page includes a Roll Call Attendance assignment, your instructor is taking attendance in your course. As part of the assignment, you can view your attendance record in your course. Like any other Canvas assignment, you can also view or leave comments in the submission details page.
If the Roll Call Attendance assignment is available to you, this lesson shows you how to view your attendance report through the Grades page. However, if your instructor allows you to view the Assignments link in Course Navigation, you can also access the submission details through the
Assignments page
by opening the Attendance assignment.
Note
: If the Roll Call Attendance assignment does not appear in the Grades page, your instructor has chosen to not use Attendance for grading.
Open Grades
In Course Navigation, click the
Grades
link.
Open Assignment
Click the name of the Roll Call Attendance assignment.
Authorize Account
The first time you view the Roll Call Attendance assignment, you must authorize your account. Click the
Authorize
button.
View Submission Details
The submission details shows the first date that your instructor took attendance in your course [1]. You can also view an overview of your attendance record through a graph [2], with the graph key displayed to the right [3]. Attendance is identified by color, where green shows the days you were on time and present, yellow shows the days you were late, and red shows the days you were absent.
You can also view the total percentage of days you have been marked as on time in your class [3].
View Late and Absent Dates
Below the overview information, you can also view the specific days that you were marked late or absent. For each attendance record, you can view the date [1], day of the week [2], status [3], and percentage points earned [4].

input: Where is the 'Download Submissions' button in Canvas, and how can I export submissions from all courses?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to export all Canvas submissions

1) Open Canvas and go to Global Navigation > Account > Settings.  
2) In the sidebar, click Download Submissions.  
3) Click Create Export.  
4) When the export finishes, click New Export to download the ZIP file. Note: Content exports expire after 30 days.  
5) The ZIP file will download automatically. If prompted, choose to open or save it. You can also access exports via Files > MyFiles > data exports.  
6) Open the ZIP: on Mac, double-click; on Windows, right-click and select Extract All. The ZIP is stored in the data exports folder and counts toward your file quota.  
7) In the expanded folder, view submissions by course (includes group submissions and submissions from both current and concluded courses). The ZIP filename includes the export date.
context:
Document Title: How do I download assignment submissions from all my courses

How do I download assignment submissions from all my courses?
As a student, you can download all your assignment submissions in Canvas. Submissions are for both current and concluded courses and only includes any files that were submitted to fulfill an assignment; they do not include any submissions modified by instructors, such as annotated submissions.
The download also includes submissions for group assignments, even if the submission was made by another student in your group.
When the export has finished generating, submissions are downloaded as a ZIP file.
Open User Settings
In Global Navigation, click the
Account
link [1], then click the
Settings
link [2].
Download Submissions
In the sidebar, click the
Download Submissions
button.
Create Export
Click the
Create Export
button.
Download Export
When the export has completed, click the
New Export
link.
Note:
Content exports expire after 30 days and can no longer be downloaded.
The ZIP file will automatically download to your computer. If your computer asks you what to do with the file, you can choose to open the file directly, or save the file to your computer.
The filename of the ZIP file includes the date of your export.
Open ZIP File
Once the file has been downloaded, locate the ZIP file on your computer. To open the file, either double click to open it (MAC users) or right-click the file and select Extract All (PC users).
To open the ZIP file, you can also click the
Files
link.
Click the
MyFiles
link.
Click the
data exports
link.
The ZIP file is also stored in the data exports folder and counts toward the student's file quota.
View Submissions
Open the expanded folder and view your assignment submissions by course.

input: How do I submit a Canvas Elementary assignment via File Upload or Website URL?
expected_output:
Here are concise, step-by-step instructions to submit a Canvas Elementary assignment using File Upload or Website URL.

1) Open the assignment
- Go to the Homeroom Schedule (or your subject’s Schedule/Modules/Calendar) and click the assignment name to view details.

2) Check submission options
- In Assignment Details, confirm that File Upload or Website URL is an allowed submission type.
- If you see a Start Assignment button, click it to begin.

3) Submit via File Upload
- Click the File Upload tab.
- Choose to Upload a file from your computer OR take a photo with your webcam.
- Select the file or capture the photo. Note: Canvas supports file uploads under 5 GB; not all file types may be allowed.
- After the file is ready, click Submit Assignment.

4) Submit via Website URL
- Click the Website URL tab.
- Copy the file’s URL (for example, a Google Drive link), paste it into the provided field, and then click Submit Assignment.

5) After submission
- Check the submission in the sidebar (a download link appears if you uploaded a file).
- If allowed, you can “New Attempt” to resubmit. Only the most recent submission is shown in the sidebar, though instructors can view all submissions.

6) Troubleshooting tips
- If you don’t see the Submit Assignment link, check the assignment description or availability date, or contact your instructor.
- If the assignment is not online or looks different, it may require a different submission method or follow the Assignment Enhancements guide.
- Large files or unsupported file types may block submission; ensure the file is within limits and allowed by the instructor.
context:
Document Title: How do I submit an online assignment in Canvas for Elementary

How do I submit an online assignment in Canvas for Elementary?
This lesson shows you how to submit an online assignment using Canvas for Elementary. If your course appears differently than this lesson, follow the guide on
how to submit an online assignment
in Classic Canvas.
You can submit online assignments in Canvas for Elementary using several submission types. Instructors can choose what kind of online submissions they want you to use. You may also have the option to resubmit assignments if your instructor allows.
This lesson shows how to turn in a standard online assignment.
Third-Party File Application Submissions
You can submit assignments from Google Drive, Dropbox, or another third-party service via your desktop computer in one of two ways:
Download the file to your computer and
submit as a File Upload
Share the file, copy the file URL, and submit as a Website URL
Notes:
Not all file types may be available for your assignment, depending on the assignment submission type set by your instructor.
Not all of your assignments may be submitted online. If you cannot see the Submit Assignment link, your instructor may want you to submit your assignment in a different way or the availability date has passed. View the description of the assignment for instructions, or contact your instructor for assistance.
Canvas does not support file uploads larger than 5 GB.
If enabled in your account, Canvas plays a celebration animation when you submit an assignment on time. However, if you prefer, you can
disable this feature setting
in your user settings.
If the assignment you are accessing displays differently than the steps in this lesson, your assignment may be using the Assignment Enhancements feature. Follow the guide on
how to submit an online assignment in Canvas for Elementary using Assignment Enhancements
.
Group assignments do not support the student annotation submission type.
Open Schedule
In the Homeroom [1], click the
Schedule
tab [2].
Note:
You can also access assignments through your subject's Schedule tab, your subject's Modules tab, or the Calendar link in Global Navigation.
Open Assignment
The Homeroom Schedule displays this week's items for all of your subjects.
To view items for previous or future weeks, click the
Previous
or
Next
buttons [1].
To view your missing assignments, click the
Show missing items
drop-down [2].
To open an assignment, click the assignment name [3].
View Assignment Details
Assignment details display including the due date [1], points [2], allowed submission types [3], allowed submission attempts [4], and the assignment description [5].
If the assignment includes a rubric, the rubric displays [6].
View Submission Attempts
Your instructor may limit the number of submission attempts you are allotted for an assignment. If your assignment has a limited number of submissions, you can view the number of submission attempts you have made [1] and the number of submission allowed for the assignment [2].
Once you have used all your submission attempts, the
New Attempt
button displays as disabled [3].
View Final Grade Notice
A banner may appear above your assignment to indicate that your instructor has removed the assignment from total grade calculations. However, this setting does not affect assignment submissions.
Start Assignment
To begin your assignment, click the
Start Assignment
button.
Note:
If you cannot see the Start Assignment button, your instructor may not want you to submit your assignment online or the availability date has passed. View the description of the assignment for instructions, or contact your instructor for assistance.
Select Submission Type
Your instructor decides what kinds of submissions are appropriate for each assignment.
There are five submission types: Student Annotation [1], File Upload [2], Text Entry [3], Website URL [4], and Media [5]. You can only select one submission type per submission.
Notes:
If a subject application can be used to upload submissions, such as the Google Doc app, additional submission options may display [6].
Your instructor may choose to restrict file types that can be submitted to the assignment.
Submit Student Annotation

Your instructor may choose to restrict file types that can be submitted to the assignment.
Submit Student Annotation
To
submit an annotated document
, click the
Student
Annotation
tab.
Note:
Group assignments do not support the student annotation submission type.
Submit File Upload
To
upload a file
from your computer or
take a photo using your webcam
and submit it as your assignment, click the
File Upload
tab.
Submit Text Entry
To submit a
text entry
assignment, click the
Text Entry
tab.
Note:
The assignment submission Rich Content Editor includes a word count display below the bottom right corner of the text box.
Submit Website URL
To submit a
website URL
, click the
Website URL
tab.
Submit Media Recording
To
submit a media recording
, click the
Media
tab.
Submit Assignment
When you are ready to submit your assignment, click the
Submit Assignment
button.
Note:
Large files submitted using the File Upload tab display a submission status indicator.
View Submission
After you have submitted your work, submission information displays in the sidebar [1]. If a file was uploaded, the sidebar provides a link to download your submission.
If you choose, you may resubmit another version of your assignment using the
New Attempt
button [2]. You will only be able to view the details of your most recent submission in the sidebar, but your instructor can see all of your submissions.
Once your instructor has graded your submission, you can view your
assignment grade
and
assignment feedback
.
Notes:
When you submit your assignment, the assignment is automatically marked as completed in your schedule.
When you resubmit an assignment, you can only access and view your most recent submission. However, instructors can view all of your submissions.

input: How do I view instructor feedback in Canvas for an elementary course as a non-technical user?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to view instructor feedback in Canvas for an elementary course (non-technical user)

1) Open Canvas and go to the Homeroom where you see the Grades tab.
2) Click the subject name to open the grade details for that course.
3) If your instructor left feedback, click the View Feedback link to open it. (This link only appears when feedback exists.)
4) In the submission details, look at the Comments section in the sidebar for instructor feedback. If there is annotated feedback, click View Feedback to open Canvas DocViewer.
5) In DocViewer, you can read the annotations and, if needed, reply to comments. If you want to expand long comments, look for the ellipses (…) to see more content.
6) If you or your instructor added annotated feedback in a file, you can also download a PDF of the submission with annotations by clicking the Download icon.
7) If the assignment is a group submission and you’re not in a group, you may not see comments in Submission Details. Try viewing comments from the Grades page or the Submission Comments folder in Inbox.
8) Troubleshooting tips:
   - If you don’t see the View Feedback link, no feedback has been left yet.
   - If the Preview button appears instead of View Feedback, the file isn’t DocViewer compatible; view it in your system PDF viewer or download it.
context:
Document Title: How do I view assignment feedback from my instructor in Canvas

How do I view assignment feedback from my instructor in Canvas for Elementary?
This lesson shows you how to view assignment feedback from my instructor in Canvas for Elementary. If your course appears differently than this lesson, follow the guide on
how to view assignment feedback from my instructor using Assignment Enhancements
in Classic Canvas.
You can view most assignment comments in the assignment submission sidebar. However, your instructor may choose to include comments directly in an assignment submission using inline comments, or annotations. If an assignment's submission details page includes a
View Feedback
button, you can view these annotated comments through a preview tool called Canvas DocViewer. You can also use
Canvas DocViewer
to reply to any comments or make your own annotations.
Some browsers may not initially render comments correctly when viewing feedback. If your browser includes a built-in PDF viewer, select the option to view the PDF in the system viewer. You can also download PDF files with comments to view on your computer. The settings required to view or print the annotations in the PDF vary based on the software installed on your computer.
Notes:
If the assignment attachment displays a
Preview
button instead of the
View Feedback
button, your file is not DocViewer compatible and will not include any annotated comments.
If you submitted a group assignment but are not a member of a group, instructor comments may not display in the Submission Details page. You can view comments from your Grades page or the Submission Comments folder of the Inbox.
Open Subject Grades
From the Homeroom, click the
Grades
tab [1].
To view grade details for a subject, click the subject name [2].
Open Submission Feedback
If your instructor has added feedback to your submission, you can view their feedback by clicking the
View Feedback
link.
Note:
The View Feedback link only displays if your instructor has left feedback on your submission.
View Submission Feedback
Any instructor comments added to your submission, as well as any comments added by you, appear in the Comments portion of the sidebar [1].
If your assignment includes a rubric, your instructor may also
leave comments in the rubric
[2].
If you submitted the assignment with a file upload, your instructor may have included annotated feedback in your assignment. If your instructor included annotated feedback, you can view it by clicking the
View Feedback
link [3].
Note:
If the assignment attachment displays a
Preview
button, your file is not DocViewer compatible.
View Annotated Feedback
View the annotated comments from your instructor [1].
To reply to a comment, click on the comment and click the
Reply
button [2].
When an annotated comment includes multiple content lines, the content box displays an ellipses link [3]. To expand a comment, click the ellipses link.
To view stacked replies, click the comment to expand all replies [4]. You can also
use DocViewer
to make your own annotations on your assignment.
To download a PDF of the submission and annotations, click the
Download
icon [5].
Add Comments
To add a comment to your assignment submission, type your comment in the sidebar's
Add a Comment
field [1]. All comments left on a group assignment submission are sent to the instructor and the whole group [2].
To attach a file, click the
Attach File
link [3].
To add a media comment, click the
Media Comment
link [4]. You can
record a video or record an audio comment
to send to your instructor.
To submit your comment, click the
Save
button [5].

input: As a new Canvas user, how can I view all course assignments on the Assignments Index page?
expected_output:
1) Open Canvas and navigate to the course you want to view.  
2) In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. If you don’t see it, you can still access assignments from the user or course dashboard, the Syllabus, Gradebook, Calendar, or Modules.  
3) On the Assignments Index page, you’ll see all course assignments. By default they’re grouped as Overdue, Upcoming, Undated, and Past.  
4) Use filters and search:
   - Click Type to view by assignment, discussion, or quiz.
   - If your course uses Multiple Grading Periods, view by grading period.
   - Use the Search for assignment field to find an assignment by title or keyword.  
5) Open an assignment by clicking its name to view details (Assignment Summary shows title, due date, and points).  
6) In the Assignment Summary, use the Attempt dropdown to view submissions, check the Progress Tracker, add a comment with Add Comment, see the number of allowed attempts and availability dates, and review Details or rubric if available. If the assignment is still accepting submissions, choose a submission type in Choose a submission type.  
7) If the assignment is part of a module, use Previous/Next to navigate module items. Note availability dates (Available until, Not Available Until, or Closed) and the 12 am rule for last submission times.  
8) For quick help, press Shift+? to view keyboard shortcuts. If an assignment appears differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled or the assignment type may not be supported.
context:
Document Title: How do I view an assignment in a course using Assignment

How do I view an assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements as a student?
You can view all your course assignments on the Assignments Index page.
Notes:
Your instructor may choose to hide the Assignments link in Course Navigation. If the Assignments link is not available, you can still access assignments through your user or course dashboard, the Syllabus, Gradebook, Calendar, or Modules.
Observers can view all content from submitted assignments. However, observers cannot view assignment drafts.
If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view
this guide
for more information.
Open Assignments
In Course Navigation, click the
Assignments
link.
View Assignments Index Page
In the Assignments Index page, you can view all the assignments in your course.
By default, assignments are grouped by overdue assignments, upcoming assignments, undated assignments, and past assignments.
Overdue Assignments
[1]: assignments and discussions that are past the due date, are still available, have not been submitted, and have not been graded.
Upcoming Assignments
[2]: assignments, discussions, and quizzes that have an upcoming due date.
Undated Assignments
[3]: assignments, discussions, and quizzes that do not have a due date.
Past Assignments
[4]: assignments and discussions that are past the due date and either are not available, have been submitted, or have received a grade; quizzes that are past the due date.
Each assignment also includes an icon with the assignment type: assignment [5], discussion [6], or quiz [7].
Note:
The Assignments Index page supports keyboard shortcuts. To view a list of keyboard shortcuts, press the Shift+Question Mark keys simultaneously on your keyboard.
View Assignment Summary
Each assignment displays the assignment name [1], availability dates (if any) [2], due date (if any) [3], and points possible [4].
View Availability Dates
The first dates you may see are called availability dates. Sometimes your instructor only wants you to submit an assignment during a specified date range, so the available dates are the range of time that the assignment is accessible to you.
If the assignment does not have a date listed [1], the assignment is open; you can submit the assignment at any time during your course.
If the assignment says
Available until
[date] [2], you can submit the assignment until the specified date.
If the assignment says
Not Available Until
[date] [3], the assignment is locked until the specified date.
If the assignment says
Closed
[4], the assignment cannot accept submissions.
Note:
If the listed date is set to 12 am the last day for the assignment to be submitted is the full day before the listed date. For instance, if an assignment is Available until December 15, you can access the assignment until December 14 at 11:59 pm.
View Due Dates
An assignment may display a second date, which is the
Due date
[1]. Any assignments submitted after the due date are marked as late; some instructors may deduct points for late submissions. Again, not all assignments may include a Due date.
Due dates also include a time [2]. If your instructor does not set a due time, the listed date displays the course's default due time.
You can still submit late assignments before the
Available until
date [3].
Please be aware that the Due date may be
before or on
the Available date.
Filter Assignments
If your course includes Multiple Grading Periods, you can view assignments by grading period [1]. You can search for an assignment by typing an assignment title or a keyword in the
Search for assignment
field [2].
By default, assignments on the Assignments Index page display by due date. To view assignments by type (assignment, discussion, quiz), click the
Type
button [3].
Open Assignment
To view the details of an assignment, click the name of the assignment.
View Assignment
The
Assignment Summary
header displays the assignment title, due date, and points possible [1]. Not all assignments may have a due date.
The
Attempt|Document Title: How do I view an assignment in a course using Assignment

View Assignment
The
Assignment Summary
header displays the assignment title, due date, and points possible [1]. Not all assignments may have a due date.
The
Attempt
drop-down allows you to view your submission attempts for the assignment [2]. By default, the Attempt drop-down displays your most recent submission attempt.
The
Progress Tracker
displays the assignment submission and grading status [3].
To
add an assignment comment for your instructor
, click the
Add Comment
button [4].
View the number of allowed attempts [5] and availability dates [6].
If your instructor added assignment instructions, they display in the
Details
section [7].
If a rubric has been added to the assignment, the
View Rubric
section automatically expands to display the assignment rubric [8].
If the assignment is accepting submissions, you can select a permitted submission type from the
Choose a submission type
section [9].
Notes:
If your assignment is part of a module, you can view the previous module item by clicking the
Previous
button [10] and the next module item by clicking the
Next
button [11].
Assignment instructions can only be downloaded if your instructor has included a link to download them. You can also print the screen or copy and paste the directions into a word processing program. You can also view the assignment in the Canvas mobile app.
If the assignment allows multiple attempts and is within its set availability dates, you can resubmit the assignment.
View Assignment with Availability Dates
When you access an assignment during its set availability dates, you can view all available assignment information. Availability dates may include a first available date (open date), last available date (locked or closed), or both dates to create an overall date range. The Due date may be
before or on
the last available date (if one is set).
If you were to miss the assignment submission due date [1], you could still submit the assignment until the last available date [2]. Once the last available date passes, you can no longer submit the assignment.
View Assignment with Limited Attempts
Your instructor may limit the number of submission attempts you are allotted for an assignment. If your assignment has a limited number of submissions, you can view your submission attempts [1] and the number of allowed submissions for the assignment [2].
Once you have used all your submission attempts, the
New Attempt
button will disappear [3].
View Locked Assignment
If an assignment is not within its set availability dates, you cannot view assignment details nor submit or resubmit work.
Locked assignments display locked icon and message [1]. If your assignment is locked due to module prerequisites, you can view course modules by click the
modules page
link [2].
View Assignment Score
If your assignment has been graded by your instructor, you can view the score for each attempt [1]. If your assignment has been graded without a submission, you can view your offline score [2].

input: Where can I find and view the rubric in Canvas when using Assignment Enhancements, and what should I do if the rubric isn’t visible?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to view the rubric and troubleshoot in Canvas (Assignment Enhancements)

1) Open Assignments
- In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link.

2) Open the assignment
- Click the name of the assignment you’re viewing.

3) View the rubric
- If a rubric has been added, the View Rubric section automatically expands to display the assignment rubric.

What to do if the rubric isn’t visible
- Not all assignments include a rubric.
- If the assignment displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type.
- Please view the guide referenced in the material for more information.
context:
Document Title: How do I view the rubric for an assignment in a course using

How do I view the rubric for an assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements? Your instructor may include a rubric as part of your assignment. The rubric is a set of criteria that your instructor will use to grade your assignment. Before submitting your assignment, you can use the rubric to evaluate your own work and make sure your assignment fulfills your instructor's requirements. Notes: Not all assignments may include a rubric. If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view this guide for more information.  Open Assignments In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. Open Assignment Click the name of an assignment. View Rubric If a rubric has been added to the assignment, the View Rubric section automatically expands to display the assignment rubric.

input: How do I submit a Canvas online assignment using Assignment Enhancements and the different submission types?
expected_output:
1) Open the course and go to Assignments.
2) Click the assignment name to view details.
3) In Choose a submission type, select the submission type you’ll use (Text Entry, Website URL, Media, Annotation, File Upload, or External Tool). If only one type is allowed, the options may not display.
4) If you choose Text Entry:
   - Click Text.
   - Enter your answer in the Rich Content Editor.
   - The draft is saved automatically as a submission draft.
5) If you choose Website URL:
   - Click Web URL.
   - Type or paste the URL.
   - The URL is saved as a submission draft.
6) If you choose Media:
   - Click Media.
   - To record, click Record Media; to upload, click Upload Media.
7) If you choose Annotation:
   - Click Annotation.
   - Use the Docviewer to annotate the document.
   - Note: Group assignments do not support student annotation.
8) If you choose File Upload:
   - Click Upload.
   - Drag and drop a file, or use Browse to select a file.
   - Optionally use Webcam or Canvas Files to add a file.
   - The file is saved as a submission draft.
9) If you see Course App File options (e.g., Google Drive, Office 365):
   - Click More, then the app name.
   - Select a file or URL; it’s saved as a submission draft.
10) When ready, click Submit Assignment. If you need to cancel, click Cancel Attempt. If you used a text entry, ensure the draft is saved before submitting.
11) View submission status:
    - After submission, the Progress Tracker shows Submitted.
    - To resubmit, select New Attempt.
    - To review previous submissions, use the Attempt drop-down.
    - You can add a comment for your instructor with Add Comment.
12) Troubleshooting and notes:
    - If resubmission isn’t allowed, your instructor may have limited attempts or the assignment may be closed.
    - Not all file types are available for every assignment type; some assignments use External Tools and may look different.
    - Canvas does not support file uploads larger than 5 GB.
    - Observers can view content but not drafts.
    - If the assignment is part of a module, you can navigate module items with Previous/Next.
    - Submissions are stored in the Submissions folder and cannot be deleted after upload.
    - Rich Content Editor uploads count toward your storage quota; attachments from graded submissions are copied to your user files but do not count toward the quota.
context:
Document Title: How do I submit an online assignment in a course using

How do I submit an online assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements? You can submit online assignments in Canvas courses that have enabled Assignment Enhancements. Instructors can choose what kind of online submissions they want you to use. This lesson shows how to turn in a standard online assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements. If your instructor allows, you may also have the option to resubmit assignments. Files uploaded using the Rich Content Editor count toward your user storage quota. Any attachments added as part of a graded assignment submission are also copied to your user files but are not counted against your user quota. Files are stored in the Submissions folder, and you can download them. However, once a file has been uploaded as a submission, you cannot delete the file. Before submitting an assignment, you may want to review all assignment information, such as the assignment rubric . Third-Party File Application Submissions You can submit assignments from Google Drive, Dropbox, or another third-party service via your desktop computer in one of two ways: Download the file to your computer and submit as a File Upload Share the file, copy the file URL, and submit as a Website URL Notes: If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view this guide for more information. Assignment Enhancements does not support Cloud Assignments. If your instructor has created an External Tool assignment, the Assignment Submission page may appear differently depending on the tool. Not all file types may be available for your assignment, depending on the assignment submission type set by your instructor. For instruction on completing an assignment, view the assignment details or contact your instructor for assistance. Canvas does not support file uploads larger than 5 GB. Group assignments do not support the student annotation submission type. Observers can view all content from submitted assignments. However, observers cannot view assignment drafts.  Open Assignments In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. Note : You can also access your Assignments through your user or course dashboard, the Syllabus, Gradebook, Calendar, or Modules. Open Assignment Click the name of the assignment. Select Submission Type The following submission types are accepted using Assignment Enhancements: Text Entry, Website URL, Media, Annotation, File Upload, and external application. However, your instructor may specify which submission types are appropriate for each assignment. In the Choose a submission type section, click a submission type button. Note: If your instructor only allows one submission type or has created an External Tool assignment, the Choose a submission type section does not display. Submit Text Entry To submit a text entry assignment, click the Text button . Then, enter text in the Rich Content Editor . Once added, your text will be saved as an assignment submission draft . Submit Website URL To submit a website URL , click the Web URL button . Then, type or paste the URL in the Enter Web URL field . Once added, your website URL will be saved as an assignment submission draft. Submit Media Recording To submit a media recording , click the Media button . To create a recording, click the Record Media button . To upload a media file from your computer, click the Upload Media button . Submit Annotation To submit an annotated document , click the Annotation button . Then, use the Docviewer to annotate the document . Note: Group assignments do not support the student annotation submission type. Submit File Upload To upload a file as your submission, click the Upload button . To upload a file from your computer , drag and drop a file , or browse your computer files by clicking the Choose a file to upload link . To capture a photo of your assignment using your computer's webcam , click the Webcam button . To upload a file from your Canvas user files , click the Canvas Files button . Once uploaded, your file will be saved as an assignment submission draft. Submit|Document Title: How do I submit an online assignment in a course using

webcam , click the Webcam button . To upload a file from your Canvas user files , click the Canvas Files button . Once uploaded, your file will be saved as an assignment submission draft. Submit Course App File If added to your course, you may see options to upload a file from a course app such as Google Drive or Office 365 . To upload a file or URL from a course app, click the More button . Then click the app name . Once added, your file will be saved as an assignment submission draft. Submit Assignment When you are ready to submit your assignment, click the Submit Assignment button . If you are working on an additional assignment attempt, you can cancel your submission your assignment attempt by clicking the Cancel Attempt button . Note: If you added a text entry submission, you must save the submission draft before you can submit the assignment. View Submission When your submission is successfully submitted, the Progress Tracker displays a Submitted status  and your most recent submission displays . If you choose, you may resubmit another version of your assignment using the New Attempt button . If you've submitted multiple assignment submissions, you can view previous submissions by clicking the Attempt drop-down . To add an assignment comment for your instructor, click the Add Comment button . Notes: If your assignment is part of a module, you can view the previous module item by clicking the Previous button  and the next module item by clicking the Next button . If you're not able to resubmit work, your instructor may have limited the number of allowed submissions or the assignment may no longer be accepting submissions due to the assignment's availability dates. Once you've submitted your work, the assignment will still display in the Assignments page and the Syllabus.

input: How can I submit a group assignment on behalf of my group in Canvas via AE?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to submit a group assignment on behalf of your group in Canvas via Assignment Enhancements (AE)

1) Open the assignment
- In Course Navigation, click Assignments.
- Click the group assignment’s name.

2) Choose a submission type
- In the Choose Submission Type section, select one allowed submission type: text entry, website URL, media file, annotation, or file upload.
- If your course has external tools enabled, you can add a Google Drive or Microsoft Office 365 file/URL submission.
- If allowed by the instructor, you may also take a photo with your webcam.

3) Submit on behalf of the group
- Click Submit Assignment.
- Note: When a group submission is made, any submission drafts from other group members are deleted.

4) File handling after submission
- If you uploaded a file from your computer, it is stored in the group Submissions folder.
- If you submit a file that was previously in group files, it is stored in Submissions.
- You cannot delete a file after it has been submitted.
- If you need to submit a previously uploaded group file, move it to your user files first.

5) Confirm and review submission status
- The Progress Tracker will show a Submitted status and your latest submission.
- If multiple attempts are allowed, use the New Attempt button to resubmit.
- To view previous submissions, use the Attempt drop-down.

6) Optional: add comments to the instructor
- Click Add Comment to include an assignment comment.

7) Troubleshooting tips
- If a submission type is missing, the instructor restricted it or the assignment isn’t available yet.
- Group assignments do not support Student Annotation.
- If you cannot resubmit, check the number of allowed submissions and the assignment’s availability dates.
- If you need to submit a previously uploaded group file, move it to your user files as noted above.
context:
Document Title: How do I submit an assignment on behalf of a group using

How do I submit an assignment on behalf of a group using Assignment Enhancements? A group assignment allow students to work together on an assignment and submit it as a group using Assignment Enhancements. Any attachments added as part of a graded assignment submission are also copied to your group files but are not counted against your user quota. However, once the file has been uploaded as a submission, you cannot delete the file. If you upload a file from your computer, the file is stored in the group Submissions folder. However, please note that if you submit a file that was previously uploaded to your group files, the file is stored in your Submissions folder. Notes: When a group assignment is submitted, any submission drafts belonging to other group members are deleted. Previously uploaded group files cannot be accessed in the assignment details page. To submit a previously uploaded group file as an assignment submission, you must move the group file to user files . Group assignments do not support Student Annotation assignments.  Open Assignments In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. Open Assignment Click the name of the assignment. Choose Submission Type To begin the assignment, select a submission type from the Choose a submission type section . If external tools are installed in your course, such as Google Drive or Microsoft Office 365, you can add a Google Drive file or URL submission or a Microsoft Office 365 file or URL submission . Lastly, if allowed by your instructor, you may also take a photo of your assignment submission using your webcam. Notes: If your assignment does not list one or more of the available submission types, those submission types have been restricted by your instructor. Group assignments do not support Student Annotation assignments. Submit Assignment Click the Submit Assignment button. View Submission When your submission is successfully submitted, the Progress Tracker displays a Submitted status  and your most recent submission displays . To add an assignment comment for your instructor, click the Add Comment button . Notes: If you're not able to resubmit work, your instructor may have limited the number of allowed submissions or the assignment may no longer be accepting submissions due to the assignment's availability dates. Once you've submitted your work, the assignment will still display in the Assignments page and the Syllabus.

input: How do I submit a text-entry assignment with Assignment Enhancements in Canvas?
expected_output:
1) Open the course and go to Assignments in Course Navigation.  
2) Click the assignment name you want to submit.  
3) In Choose a submission type, select Text. (If only Text Entry is allowed, the Rich Content Editor will appear automatically.) If you don’t see Text, your instructor may have restricted this submission type. Check the assignment header/details or contact your instructor.  
4) In Draft Text Entry, type your submission in the Rich Content Editor. Use the menubar/toolbar to format text and insert content. The Editor Status bar shows the word count.  
5) Add media or images:  
   - Click the Media icon to record, upload from your computer, or upload from your user files.  
   - Click the Image icon to embed images from Canvas or the web (you can also use Insert in the menubar).  
   - If needed, click the Options icon to reveal Record/Upload Media and Images icons.  
6) When your text is ready, click Submit Assignment (your work is saved as a draft before submission). If you need to stop the submission, use Cancel Attempt.  
7) After submitting, you’ll see a Submitted status in the Progress Tracker and the latest submission will appear in read-only format. You can:  
   - Create a new version with New Attempt (resubmit).  
   - View previous submissions via the Attempt drop-down.  
   - Add feedback for your instructor with Add Comment.  
8) Troubleshooting and tips:  
   - If you can’t submit online, it may be due to availability dates, submission type restrictions, or the instructor choosing a different submission method. Check the assignment header/details or contact your instructor.  
   - Not all file types or Rich Content Editor features may be available depending on the submission type and course settings.  
   - Files uploaded via Rich Content Editor count toward storage quotas.  
9) Note: After submission, the assignment remains listed in Assignments and on Syllabus.
context:
Document Title: How do I submit a text entry assignment in a course using

How do I submit a text entry assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements?
You can submit a text entry submission in a Canvas course that uses Assignment Enhancements. Text entry assignments are created in the Rich Content Editor. This lesson shows how to turn in a standard online assignment in a course using Assignment Enhancements. If your instructor allows, you may also have the option to resubmit assignments.
Before submitting an assignment, you may want to review all assignment information, such as the assignment rubric.
Notes:
If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view
this guide
for more information.
Assignment Enhancements does not support Cloud Assignments.
Not all file types may be available for your assignment, depending on the assignment submission type set by your instructor.
Files uploaded and submitted do not count against the user’s storage quota, but those uploaded through the Rich Content Editor are counted against the user’s storage quotas.
Not all of your assignments may be submitted online. If you cannot see options to submit your work, your instructor may want you to submit your assignment in a different way or the assignment is not within its availability dates.
For instruction on completing an assignment, view the assignment details or contact your instructor for assistance.
Open Assignments
In Course Navigation, click the
Assignments
link.
Open  Assignment
Click the name of an assignment.
Select Submission Type
Your instructor may specify which submission types are appropriate for each assignment.
In the
Choose a submission type
section [1], select the
Text
option [2].

input: How to submit a Canvas assignment: upload from PC or Canvas Files, ≤500 MB?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to submit a Canvas assignment by uploading from PC or Canvas Files (≤500 MB)

- Open Course: In Course Navigation, click Assignments.
- Open assignment: Click the assignment name to view details.
- Choose submission type: If multiple types are allowed, select Upload. If only File submissions are allowed, the Upload File option will appear automatically.
- Upload from PC:
  - Drag and drop the file, or click Choose a file to upload.
  - Browse, select the file, and click Open.
- Upload from Canvas Files:
  - Click Canvas Files.
  - Select a single file (currently only one file can be uploaded at a time) and click Upload.
- Check size limit: Ensure the file is 500 MB or smaller.
- Review draft: The file appears as a draft submission. If you need to remove it, click the Delete icon before submitting.
- Submit: Click Submit Assignment to finalize.
- After submission:
  - Status will show as Submitted in the Progress Tracker.
  - You can view previous submissions with the Attempt dropdown and submit new versions with New Attempt (if allowed).
  - You can add a comment for your instructor with Add Comment.
- Troubleshooting:
  - If you don’t see Upload options, your instructor may have restricted submission types or the assignment may not be available yet.
  - If the assignment uses an External Tool, Google Drive, or Office 365, follow those specific submission paths.
  - If the file is larger than 500 MB or your submission type is unavailable, contact your instructor for alternatives.

input: How do I annotate an assignment submission using Assignment Enhancements in Canvas, and where is the Annotation button?
expected_output:
1) In Canvas, go to Course Navigation and click Assignments.  
2) Open the assignment by clicking its title.  
3) In the Choose a submission type section, click the Annotation button.  
4) If only Annotation submissions are allowed, DocViewer may appear in place of the selection area.  
5) If you don’t see the Annotation option, your instructor has restricted this submission type. Also, not all assignments can be submitted online or may be outside availability dates; check the assignment header/details or contact your instructor.  
6) Annotate your submission using DocViewer tools in the menu (download, zoom, fullscreen, selection, point, highlight, freetext, strikeout, free draw, area).  
7) When ready, click the Submit Assignment button.  
8) View your submission status in the Progress Tracker (Submitted). You can resubmit with New Attempt if allowed, and switch between attempts with the Attempt dropdown.  
9) To show feedback or communicate, use Add Comment to send an assignment comment to your instructor.  
10) Quick tips: Group assignments do not support student annotation submissions; if you can’t submit or see options, verify availability dates and consult your instructor. The assignment will still appear in Assignments and Syllabus after submission.

input: How can I enable my webcam, capture a photo, and submit it via AE in Canvas?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to enable your webcam, capture a photo, and submit it via Assignment Enhancements (AE) in Canvas:

1) Open your assignment
- In Course Navigation, click Assignments.
- Select the assignment by clicking its title.

2) Choose the webcam submission
- In Submission Type, click Upload, then click Webcam.
- Note: If you only see File Upload or the Webcam option isn’t shown, the instructor may have restricted submission types or AE may not be enabled for this assignment. Also, if the assignment doesn’t allow image types (PNG/JPEG), the Webcam option won’t display.

3) Allow camera access
- When your browser prompts, click Allow to grant access to your camera.

4) Capture your photo
- Click the Take Photo icon.
- A 3-second timer will start and the photo will be captured.

5) Review and save
- Preview the photo on the Take a Photo via Webcam page.
- Edit the photo name in the Photo Name field if desired.
- Click Save to store the photo.
- If needed, click Start Over to retake.

6) Submit your submission
- Your file will appear as a draft submission.
- If you need to delete, click the Delete icon.
- Click Submit Assignment to submit.
- If you’re on an additional attempt, you can Cancel Attempt to stop.

7) After submission
- The Progress Tracker will show a Submitted status.
- You can view the most recent submission, and if allowed, use New Attempt to resubmit.
- Use the Attempt dropdown to view previous submissions.
- Click Add Comment to send a message to your instructor.

Notes and troubleshooting
- If AE displays differently, AE may not be enabled for your course or the assignment type may not support it.
- If the assignment does not allow image file types, the Webcam option will not display.
- Not all assignments are submitted online; if you can’t see submission options, your instructor may require a different method or the assignment’s availability dates may have ended.
- Submitted photos are saved to the Submissions folder in your user files as PNG files.

input: How do I submit a media file (video or audio) in Canvas with Assignment Enhancements?
expected_output:
1) Open the course and go to Assignments in the course navigation.  
2) Click the specific assignment you want to submit.  
3) In Submission Type, ensure Media is allowed. If multiple types are allowed, choose Media. If only Media is allowed, the Media Upload tool will appear automatically.  
4) Open the media upload tool by clicking Record/Upload Media.  
5) To upload from your computer (Computer tab by default): drag-and-drop the file or click the Upload File icon, browse to the file, and click Open.  
6) Select your media file and, if needed, click Add CC/Subtitle to include captions. You can delete the file with the Delete icon.  
7) Save as a draft: click the Submit button to save as a submission draft (you can review it later).  
8) If recording: switch to the Record tab. Choose Microphone and Webcam as needed, then click Start Recording.  
9) To end and save the recording: click Finish, then Play to review. Optionally rename the file in the File Name field, then Save to submit as a draft or click Submit Assignment to finalize.  
10) Submit your media: after saving as a draft, click Submit Assignment to finalize. If you need to cancel, choose Cancel Attempt.  
11) View submission status: after submission, check the Progress Tracker for Submitted status. You may click New Attempt to submit another version, or use the Attempt dropdown to view previous submissions.  
12) Troubleshoot if needed: if you don’t see the Media submission option, your instructor may have restricted it or the assignment isn’t within its availability dates. Check the assignment header for instructions or contact your instructor. Also note: Canvas won’t accept media files larger than 500 MB, Assignment Enhancements does not support Cloud Assignments, and not all file types are available for every submission type.

Click the Media option  If your instructor only allows Media submissions, the Media Upload tool displays in place of the Choose a submission type section. Notes: If the Media submission type does not display, your instructor has restricted this submission type. Not all of your assignments may be submitted online. Record Media To record media, click the Record tab . You have the option to record video or audio to upload to the assignment. To select a microphone for your recording, click the Mic button . To select a webcam, or, to turn the webcam off for audio-only recordings, click the Webcam button . To begin recording, click the Start Recording button . To save your recording as a submission draft, click the Save button . Submit Assignment Once your media file has been saved as a draft submission, you can review it in the media player . input: How do I submit a URL in Canvas when using Assignment Enhancements, and what should I do if the URL option is missing?
expected_output:
1) Open the assignment
- In Course Navigation, click Assignments.
- Click the name of the assignment you’re submitting.

2) Check the submission type
- In the Choose a submission type section, look for Web URL.
- If only URL submissions are allowed, you’ll see the Website URL field instead.
- If you don’t see Web URL, the instructor may have restricted this submission type.

3) Enter your URL
- Click the Web URL option (or use the Website URL field if that's what’s shown).
- Type or paste the URL into the Enter Web URL field.
- Tip: You can also submit a Drive/Dropbox URL by sharing the file and submitting as a Website URL.

4) Preview your URL (optional)
- Click the View icon to open a preview in a new browser tab.

5) Submit
- Click Submit Assignment to submit your URL.

6) Manage attempts
- If you need to try again, click New Attempt to submit another version (if allowed).
- To view previous submissions, use the Attempt drop-down.
- Add a comment for your instructor with Add Comment (optional).

7) View submission status
- After submission, the Progress Tracker shows Submitted and your latest submission appears.
- You can cancel an ongoing attempt with Cancel Attempt (if available).

8) After submission
- The assignment will still appear in Assignments and Syllabus.

What to do if the URL option is missing
- The instructor may have restricted this submission type; check the assignment header/details for instructions or contact the instructor.
- Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or the assignment type may not support URL submissions.
- Not all assignments support online submissions or may be unavailable due to availability dates.
- If you still can’t see an option to submit, ask your instructor if there’s a different submission method required.

input: How to submit Google Drive/URL in Canvas; what if Google Drive option is missing?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions to submit Google Drive/URL in Canvas

1) Open the assignment
- In Course Navigation: click Assignments (also via Dashboard, Syllabus, Gradebook, Calendar, or Modules).
- Click the assignment name.

2) Choose your submission type
- If multiple types are allowed, look in the Choose a submission type section for available options.

3) Submit a Google Drive URL
- Click Web URL in Choose a submission type.
- Create a shareable Google Drive/Docs URL.
- Paste the URL into Enter Web URL and save as draft. You can preview it by clicking View.
- Submit when ready.

4) Submit a Google Drive file
- Click More in the Choose a submission type section.
- Click Google Apps (if this option displays).
- If Google Apps isn’t shown, the instructor hasn’t installed the app in the course.
- Select your Google Drive/Docs file.
- Save as draft by clicking Select, then Submit Assignment.

5) After submission
- Progress Tracker shows Submitted; your latest submission is visible.
- To resubmit, use New Attempt.
- To review earlier submissions, use the Attempt drop-down.
- To add feedback for your instructor, use Add Comment.

Notes and tips
- Google Drive submissions convert to Word/Excel/PowerPoint formats in Canvas; changes in Drive won’t update the submission.
- Only one Google Drive file can be submitted per submission.
- Canvas file size limit: 5 GB.
- If you’re missing a Google Drive option, the course may not have Assignment Enhancements enabled, or the Google Apps/LTI may not be installed by your instructor. A course with Google Drive enabled will show a Google Drive link in Course Navigation; otherwise you may need to enable Google Drive via your user profile web services.
- If you’re submitting a URL, ensure you create a shareable link so your instructor can view it.
context:
Document Title: How do I submit a Google Drive file or URL as an assignment

How do I submit a Google Drive file or URL as an assignment submission using Assignment Enhancements? If your institution has enabled Google Drive or Google Docs as a submission type and enabled Assignment Enhancements in your course, you can upload a file from Google Drive for an assignment. Unlike other assignment submissions, files from Google Drive are not uploaded into your Canvas user files. Canvas accepts Google Doc, Google Sheet, and Google Slide files. You can also upload any uploaded Word (.doc/.docx), Excel (.xls/.xlsx), PowerPoint (.ppt/.pptx), and PDF files not converted to Google Docs formatting. Notes: If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view this guide for more information. If the Google Apps submission type does not display, your instructor has not installed the app in your course. If your course displays a link to your Google Drive in the Course Navigation Menu, your course has enabled Google Drive directly. Otherwise, you must enable Google Drive a web service in your user profile to upload Google Drive files. In Google Drive assignments, you can only submit one file for your submission. When Google Drive files (docs, sheets, and slides) are uploaded as a submission, the files convert to their Microsoft counterpart file types and appear in the submission as respective Word, Excel, or PowerPoint files. This conversion essentially preserves the submission in its current state; any changes made to the file in Google Drive will not be updated in the submission. Assignment Enhancements does not support Cloud Assignments. If your instructor has created an External Tool assignment, the Assignment Submission page may appear differently depending on the tool. Canvas does not support file uploads larger than 5 GB.  Open Assignments In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. Note : You can also access your Assignments through your user or course dashboard, the Syllabus, Gradebook, Calendar, or Modules. Open Assignment Click the name of the assignment. Select Submission Type If your instructor allows multiple submission types for the assignment, accepted submission types display in the Choose a submission type section . You can add a Google Drive or Google Doc URL submission using the Web URL button . Alternatively, if the Google Apps LTI has been added to your course, you can upload a Google Drive or Google Doc file using the More button . Submit Google Drive URL To add a Google Drive or Google Docs URL as your assignment submission, click the Web URL option in the Choose a submission type section . Create a shareable URL for your Google Drive or Google Docs file . Then, in Canvas, add the shareable website URL to the Enter Web URL field . Once added, your website URL will be saved as an assignment submission draft. To preview your URL in a new browser tab, click the View icon . Note: If a shareable link is not created, your instructor will not have permission to view your file. Submit Google Drive File To upload a Google Drive or Google Docs file as your assignment submission, click the More option in the Choose a submission type section . Then click the Google Apps option . Note: If the Google Apps option does not display, your instructor has not installed the app in your course. Select File Select the appropriate Google Drive or Google Doc file . To save your upload as a draft, click the Select button . Submit Assignment To submit your your Google Drive file or URL as your assignment submission, click the Submit Assignment button . If you are working on an additional assignment attempt, you can cancel your submission by clicking the Cancel Attempt button . Note: If you submit a website URL without creating a shareable link, your instructor will not have permission to view your file. Once a shareable link is created, your instructor will have access to the submitted URL. View Submission When your submission is successfully submitted, the Progress Tracker displays a Submitted status  and your most recent submission displays . If you choose, you may resubmit|Document Title: How do I submit a Google Drive file or URL as an assignment

URL. View Submission When your submission is successfully submitted, the Progress Tracker displays a Submitted status  and your most recent submission displays . If you choose, you may resubmit another version of your assignment by clicking the New Attempt button . If you've submitted multiple assignment submissions, you can view previous submissions by clicking the Attempt drop-down . To add an assignment comment for your instructor, click the Add Comment button . Notes: If you're not able to resubmit work, your instructor may have limited the number of allowed submissions or the assignment may no longer be accepting submissions due to the assignment's availability dates. Once you've submitted your work, the assignment will still display in the Assignments page and the Syllabus.

input: How can I submit an Office 365 file via Canvas, and what should I do if the Office 365 option is missing?
expected_output:
Steps to submit an Office 365 file in Canvas

1) Open your assignment
- In Course Navigation, click Assignments, then click the assignment name.

2) Choose the submission type
- If multiple types are allowed, look in Choose a submission type.
- To use Office 365, click More, then select Microsoft Office 365.

3) Submit your Office 365 file
- Office 365 displays a list of allowed file types. Check the box next to your file.
- To save as draft, click Attach File.
- Click Submit to submit your Office 365 file.

4) Alternative: submit an Office 365 URL
- In Choose a submission type, select Web URL.
- Create a shareable URL for your Office 365 file and paste it into Enter Web URL.
- Your URL will be saved as a draft; use View to preview.

5) After submission
- Check Progress Tracker for Submitted status.
- To resubmit, click New Attempt.
- To view previous submissions, use the Attempt dropdown.
- Add a comment for your instructor if needed.

What to do if the Office 365 option is missing

- The Office 365 submission type may not display if:
  - The instructor has not installed the Office 365 app in your course.
  - Assignment Enhancements or the assignment type does not support this submission.
- Possible actions:
  - Contact your instructor to confirm Office 365/Assignment Enhancements is enabled for the course.
  - If available, use Web URL submission to link to your Office 365 file.
  - Note: You can only attach one file, uploads must be ≤ 5 GB, and changes in OneDrive after submission won’t update the submission.

input: How can I confirm Canvas submission with AE enabled?
expected_output:
Step 1: Open In-Course Assignments
- In Course Navigation, click Assignments, then select the assignment name.

Step 2: Check submission status
- View the Progress Tracker. A “Submitted” status confirms your submission.

Step 3: Review your submission
- In the Progress Tracker, view your most recent submission.

Step 4: Resubmit if allowed
- If permitted, click New Attempt to upload another version.
- If you submitted more than once, use the Attempt drop-down to view previous submissions.

Step 5: Add instructor comments (optional)
- Click Add Comment to include notes for your instructor.

Step 6: Troubleshooting and notes
- If you can’t resubmit, your instructor may have limited submissions or the assignment may be closed due to availability dates.
- Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled or the assignment type may not be supported; AE does not support Cloud Assignments.
- After submission, the assignment remains visible in Assignments and Syllabus.

Step 7: View scores (if graded)
- If graded, check the Attempt Score for each attempt (or Offline Score if graded without a submission).

Document Title: How do I know when my assignment has been submitted in a course

How do I know when my assignment has been submitted in a course using Assignment Enhancements? If Assignment Enhancements is enabled in your course, you can view an assignment to verify your assignment submission. All file submissions also appear in your personal unfiled folder . Notes: If the assignment you are accessing displays differently, Assignment Enhancements may not be enabled in your course or your instructor may not have used a supported assignment type. Please view this guide for more information. Assignment Enhancements does not support Cloud Assignments.  Open Assignments In Course Navigation, click the Assignments link. Open Assignment Click the assignment name. View Assignment Status The Progress Tracker displays the assignment submission status. A successfully submitted assignment displays a Submitted status . Additionally, you can view your most recent submission . If you choose, you may resubmit another version of your assignment using the New Attempt button . If you've submitted multiple assignment submissions, you can view previous submissions by clicking the Attempt drop-down . To add an assignment comment for your instructor, click the Add Comment button . Notes: If you're not able to resubmit work, your instructor may have limited the number of allowed submissions or the assignment may no longer be accepting submissions due to the assignment's availability dates. Once you've submitted your work, the assignment will still display in the Assignments page and the Syllabus. View Assignment Score If your assignment has been graded by your instructor, you can view the score for each attempt in the Attempt Score field . If your assignment has been graded without a submission, you can view your score in the Offline Score field .

input: How do I submit a Canvas self-assessment for an assignment, and can I resubmit to improve my score?
expected_output:
Yes. You can resubmit to improve your assignment score by creating a new attempt. The self-assessment itself has no grade, but you can re-evaluate after resubmitting the assignment if enabled.

Step-by-step instructions:
1) In Course Navigation, click Assignments.
2) Open the assignment name.
3) If you want to try again, click New Attempt to submit another version (you can switch between previous and current submissions using the Attempt dropdown).
4) After resubmitting, look for the Self-Assess button (if enabled by your instructor) and click it.
5) In the self-assessment tray:
   - Select your score [1].
   - Add comments [2].
   - If your rubric includes outcomes, view details by clicking the outcome link [3].
   - If not all criteria are scored, you’ll see Incomplete [4]; score all criteria to see Complete.
6) Click Submit Assessment [5] to save your self-assessment.
7) Important notes:
   - Self-assessments do not affect grades.
   - You cannot edit a self-assessment after submission unless you resubmit the assignment.
   - Self-assessments have no separate deadline; they’re tied to the assignment’s open period.
   - If you don’t see Self-Assess, Assignment Enhancements may be disabled or not applicable to the assignment.
